title: CSS—Room for improvement
content:
CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) is a language that goes along with HTML to add style to the page. CSS is really important in website design in the modern world. Look at google with no css: It looks something like

.class-name {
background-color: #EE66EE;
border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(40, 60, 80, 0.5);
}
body {
background-image: url(https://www.google.ca/images/branding/googlelogo/2x/googlelogo_color_272x92dp.png)
}

CSS can get messy (look at css for this website :P.) That's why there should be better orginization support to make it earier to find stuff hidden in lines and lines of code. I am thinking of making a cleaner css compiler. I'll post later if I'm successful.
